title: 'Team Huddle': Was Yemen war plan discussed with family by US defense secretary?
content: US Defence Secretary Hegseth faces scrutiny after sharing sensitive military details about a Yemen airstrike in a private Signal chat with his family and lawyer. This follows a prior incident where similar information was leaked, prompting a Pentagon investigation and internal turmoil. Concerns are mounting over the handling of classified materials and potential breaches of security protocols.

title: 'EC is compromised': Rahul Gandhi rakes up voter fraud claims during US visit
content: Rahul Gandhi, while addressing the Indian diaspora in Boston, alleged that the Election Commission of India is compromised. He cited irregularities in the Maharashtra assembly elections, claiming a statistically impossible surge in voter turnout within a short period. The Election Commission refuted these claims, stating that the electoral rolls were updated with minimal contestation.

title: MS Dhoni reflects on CSK's dismal IPL 2025
content: Chennai Super Kings suffered a crushing 9-wicket defeat against Mumbai Indians, exposing glaring weaknesses in their bowling and batting execution. Despite fifties from Jadeja and Dube, CSK's playoff hopes dwindle as they remain at the bottom of the table with only two wins.

title: George Soros' son wishes Happy Easter, Elon Musk responds: You ...
content: A brief exchange on X between Alex Soros and Elon Musk has sparked intrigue, given their families' history of public disagreements. It began when Alex Soros shared Easter greetings, to which Musk responded with, “Um … you too”.

title: Watch: MS Dhoni's animated argument with umpire goes viral
content: Following a crushing nine-wicket defeat to Mumbai Indians, a visibly upset MS Dhoni engaged in a heated discussion with the umpires. Dhoni admitted CSK's performance was subpar, citing a failure to capitalize on the middle overs and dropped catches.

title: IPL: From Rishabh Pant to Rohit Sharma - big investments, low returns
content: The IPL 2025 season sees some of its most expensive players struggling to justify their hefty price tags. Rishabh Pant, Venkatesh Iyer, and Rashid Khan have underperformed with both bat and ball. Pat Cummins' captaincy hasn't translated to wins for Sunrisers Hyderabad, while Rohit Sharma's inconsistency plagues Mumbai Indians despite a recent resurgence.

title: Infosys HR’s email to 240 trainees who failed the test: As you …
content: Infosys recently terminated 240 entry-level employees after they failed to clear internal assessment tests, following a similar layoff of over 300 trainees in February. Despite additional preparation and multiple attempts, these System Engineers and Digital Specialist Engineers did not meet the required standards.

title: Baraat on foot: Jammu-Srinagar Highway blocked, groom, kin trek to wedding
content: A groom in Jammu and Kashmir, Mashkoor, had to walk to his wedding venue after landslides blocked the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway due to heavy rainfall. Starting at 6 am, he and his procession trekked, leaving their vehicles behind. He appealed to the government to clear the highway (NH 44) promptly.

title: Taj Mahal visit, meeting with PM Modi & more: What's lined up for JD Vance
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, is commencing a four-day visit to India amidst trade tensions. He will meet PM Modi to discuss the India-US trade agreement. The Vance family will explore cultural landmarks in Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra, including Amer Fort and the Taj Mahal. Vance will also address India-US relations at the Rajasthan International Centre.

title: No crash diets, no fads: How Jyotika lost 9kgs and found her fitness formula
content: Jyotika, inspired by Vidya Balan, transformed her health journey by focusing on gut health and holistic wellness, shedding 9 kilos. Jyotika’s story isn’t one of shortcuts or overnight change. It’s about learning the body, understanding its signals, and choosing strength—both inside and out. Her 9kg weight loss is proof that real change comes with awareness, balance, and belief.

title: Free 5-star AC under PM Modi AC Yojana 2025? Govt issues clarification
content: A viral social media message falsely claims the Indian government is giving away 1.5 crore 5-star air conditioners under the 'PM Modi AC Yojana 2025'. PIB Fact Check has debunked this claim, clarifying that no such scheme exists. The government advises the public to avoid clicking on unknown links or sharing personal information and to verify claims with official sources.

title: From Dhoni to Rathi: How have uncapped players fared in IPL 2025 so far?
content: IPL 2025 sees uncapped players shine. Digvesh Rathi leads bowlers with consistent performance. Priyansh Arya hits a century with a high strike rate. MS Dhoni scores 134 runs with a strike rate of 152.27. Some uncapped players struggle with economy and consistency. New heroes emerge from unexpected places in the league.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 550 points up; Nifty50 near 24,000
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, continued their upward trend on Monday morning. While BSE Sensex crossed the 79,000 mark, Nifty50 was close to 24,000.

title: Unemployed JACs, teacher association thank Naidu for fulfilling promise on Mega DSC
content: Unemployed JAC State convener Shaik Siddiq thanked the Chief Minister for fulfilling his promise on Mega DSC. He said the credit for filling nearly 80% of teacher posts even in the united Andhra Pradesh goes to Mr. Naidu.

title: Cautious narrative, sobering outlook: Top IT companies’ results trail expectations amid tariff woes
content: India's top-rung IT services companies TCS, Infosys and Wipro disappointed with their March quarter and full year FY25 scorecards on multiple counts

title: Murshidabad violence: Sukanta Majumdar targets Mamata, says she made West Bengal ‘Bangladesh version lite’
content: MEA condemned the incident in Bangladesh and urged the interim Government in Bangladesh to ensure protection for all minorities

title: Jailed Punjab MP Amritpal's father slams Mann Government for extending his son's detention under NSA
content: Tarsem Singh criticises Punjab Government for extending Amritpal’s detention under NSA, calling it a threat to democracy.

title: All schools in Kashmir to remain shut on April 21 amid heavy rains
content: Kashmir valley has been lashed by heavy rains over the past 48 hours even as the weather office has forecast more precipitation over the next 24 hours.

title: J.D. Vance India visit LIVE: U.S. Vice President lands in Delhi on four-day trip with wife and officials
content: The U.S. Vice President will deliver an address on Tuesday at the Rajasthan International Centre in Jaipur, where he is likely to make a policy statement on India-U.S. ties

title: Adding community to the equation of elderly care
content: By 2050, the elderly population, for the first time, is expected to exceed the population aged 0-15. This underscores the importance of turning the healthcare spotlight on the elderly, with community participation in focus, say experts

title: Concern over Bangladesh embankment along river on Tripura border
content: A high-level team visited southern Tripura on Sunday to assess the flood protection measures on the Indian side

title: AITUC seeks probe into ‘irregularities’ at Rayachoti sub-registrar office
content: Sambashiva alleged that properties under YSR Kadapa district were being registered at the Rayachoti sub-registrar office in Annamayya district and that bribes were being collected for this

title: Maharashtra language panel rejects govt. decision to make Hindi compulsory in schools
content: In a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, the panel has urged the government to scrap the order

title: Commute on OMR has been tough after Metro work began: motorists
content: They say though traffic moves without snarls thanks to U-turns introduced at various junctions the lack of space at certain portions of the road is a problem. Pedestrians are the worst hit, since footpaths have just vanished along the road

title: New microcontinent sheds light on tectonic history
content: Researchers have discovered a previously unknown proto-microcontinent, the Davis Strait proto microcontinent, beneath the Davis Strait between Greenland and Canada. This landmass, composed of thick continental crust, formed during the separation of Greenland and North America. The discovery highlights the significant role of lithospheric structures in influencing tectonic plate movement and suggests microcontinents are more common than previously believed.

title: Shikhar Dhawan blames former captain for losing against Pakistan
content: During a commentary stint, Shikhar Dhawan playfully blamed Ambati Rayudu for India's 2004 U-19 World Cup loss to Pakistan. Dhawan recalled Rayudu's one-match ban for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct due to excessive time-wasting in a group match against Sri Lanka. Consequently, Rayudu missed the semifinal, which India lost, and Pakistan ultimately won the tournament.

title: Wall tweaks on ground floor led to Delhi building collapse?
content: Delhi Police is investigating whether alterations at a ground-floor meat shop triggered the collapse of a four-storey building in Mustafabad, resulting in 11 deaths. The FIR indicates unauthorized construction work at the shop just before the incident. Authorities are also probing potential seepage and will examine building approvals and compliance, while grieving families search for lost belongings amidst the rubble.

title: Watch: Kohli follows Anushka's lead as they dance together
content: A viral behind-the-scenes video showcases Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's playful chemistry during an advertisement shoot in Dubai. The couple, dressed in casual attire, were seen dancing together with background artists around a pool, captivating onlookers. This isn't the first time fans have captured such moments, as the duo seamlessly blends work with fun.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for week starting April 21
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends Hindustan Aeronautics, citing its strong order book and transition to indigenized models, projecting significant revenue and profit growth. They also suggest Castrol, anticipating improved profit margins due to lower crude prices and strategic investments in technology and brand building.

title: 'Horrifying': Harvard students rattled as subway shooting unfolds nearby
content: A gunman opened fire at Harvard Square station in Boston, causing panic and a temporary shelter-in-place order from Harvard University. The suspect fired several shots on the Red Line platform, apparently targeting an individual, before fleeing. While no injuries were reported, the incident disrupted transit services and prompted an ongoing police investigation, raising public safety concerns.

title: Tariff war: China 'firmly opposes' nations forming trade deals at its expense
content: China has issued a stern warning against countries entering trade agreements with the U.S. at Beijing's expense, threatening countermeasures. This follows reports of potential U.S. tariff exemptions for nations limiting trade with China.

title: IPL match today, KKR vs GT: Team prediction, pitch report, weather update
content: Kolkata Knight Riders, led by Ajinkya Rahane, are set to face Shubman Gill's Gujarat Titans at Eden Gardens. KKR is looking to rebound after a shocking loss, while Gujarat Titans, bolstered by Prasidh Krishna's strong bowling, currently lead the points table. The pitch conditions at Eden Gardens are under scrutiny, with teams considering dew as a factor.

title: Trump administration may revoke $1 billion in grants from Harvard: Report
content: The US government is escalating its conflict with Harvard University, planning to withdraw another $1 billion in federal grants and research contracts. This follows Harvard's refusal to comply with policy requirements, including government oversight of admissions and staff ideology. Harvard President Alan M. Garber stated the university would not surrender its independence.

title: Sunny Deol film 'Jaat' holds well, nears Rs 75 crore
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat,' also featuring Randeep Hooda and Vineet Kumar Singh, is performing well at the box office, earning ₹74.55 crore in eleven days. Despite a controversy over a church scene, which was later removed, and competition from Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari 2,' 'Jaat' saw decent growth over the second weekend. It made ₹5 crore on Sunday.

title: 'Hopefully they will do it this week': Trump's big hint on Russia-Ukraine 'deal'
content: Donald Trump hinted at a potential Russia-Ukraine peace agreement this week, suggesting it could lead to lucrative business opportunities with the U.S. However, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that Washington might withdraw from peace efforts if progress isn't swift. Despite negotiations, Moscow demands Kyiv halt military mobilization and Western arms supplies, hindering a comprehensive ceasefire.

title: US defense chief shared sensitive Yemen strike info with wife, lawyer: Report
content: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is under scrutiny for allegedly sharing sensitive military information about Yemen operations in a private Signal group, his second such incident. The group included his wife, brother, and personal lawyer. This follows an earlier leak involving National Security Advisor Mike Waltz, prompting a Pentagon investigation.

title: Maharashtra language panel opposes Hindi from class 1
content: Maharashtra's Language Advisory Committee has publicly opposed the introduction of Hindi as a third language for students in Classes I to V, sparking debate and putting the state government on the defensive. The committee argues the move is academically unjustified and not in line with students' psychology.

title: Heatwaves set to return in parts of north and central India, warns IMD
content: After a brief respite due to recent wet spells, northwest and central India are bracing for another heatwave. The IMD forecasts a gradual temperature increase of 2-3 degrees Celsius in northwest India over the next five days, with isolated pockets of south UP, MP, Rajasthan, Haryana, and Vidarbha likely to experience heatwave conditions.

title: Israel cancels visas of 27 French MPs as Macron signals support for Palestinian state
content: Israel revoked the entry visas of 27 French lawmakers and officials, citing threats to national interests, just before their planned visit to Israel and Palestinian territories. The group, comprised of left-wing members, said it intended to promote peace and cooperation. This action, denounced as collective punishment, follows similar incidents involving British and European politicians, highlighting tensions over Palestinian statehood recognition.

title: IPL: Rohit Sharma goes beast mode as MI humble Dhoni's CSK
content: Rohit Sharma silenced critics with a blistering, unbeaten 76, his highest IPL 2025 score, propelling Mumbai Indians to a dominant nine-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings. Coming in as an Impact Substitute, Sharma partnered with Suryakumar Yadav for a match-winning 114-run stand. Jasprit Bumrah's bowling earlier restricted CSK, setting the stage for MI's triumphant chase.

title: Assam man kills wife, walks to cops with severed head
content: In a shocking incident in Assam's Chirang district, Britesh Hajong, 60, was arrested for allegedly beheading his wife, Baijayanti Hajong, 50, during an argument in front of their daughters. Police reported that Hajong surrendered himself at the Ballamguri Police patrolling point with the severed head.

title: Physicist and teacher A.P. Balachandran passes away
content: He was the Joel Dorman Steele emeritus professor at Syracuse University and an internationally recognised theoretical physicist

title: New check dam, restored water channel across Palar near Katpadi inaugurated
content: According to the WRD officials, the entire channel has been desilted to a distance of 12.7 km and a depth of four metres, and widened up to three metres; the check dam has been built at ₹9.7 crore

title: MP, TDP leaders celebrate Naidu’s birthday in Vijayawada
content: People recognised the abilities of Chandrababu Naidu, and gave the TDP-Jana Sena Party-BJP alliance a resounding victory in the 2024 elections, says Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath

title: Chief Minister cancels programme over unauthorised nature of venue
content: Meanwhile, the Samithi activists staged a protest in front of the three gates of the building, saying that they shall not allow vehicles to be parked in the vast ground beside the building, which, they claimed, was a landfill on the Kottooli wetlands, a proposed Ramsar site.

title: Team from T.N. participates in kite festival in Weifang, China
content: The event, recognised as the world’s prestigious kite festival, takes place in Weifang, Shandong Province, which is renowned as the ‘Kite Capital of the World’

title: Police flummoxed by loose ends in shootout on Rikki Rai
content: The hitman has shot at the car from the driver’s side, knowing pretty well it will not directly hit Rikki Rai, a senior official pointed out

title: Is nitrogen, the building block of life, a latent time-bomb?
content: Nitrous oxide is the third most abundant of the greenhouse gases; it accentuates the greenhouse effect in the same way as carbon dioxide does by capturing re-radiated infrared radiation from the Earth’s surface and warming the troposphere; urgent action on it is critical to achieving climate goals

title: Former DGP Om Prakash’s wife called friend and claimed she killed him
content: A few days ago, Pallavi posted a series of messages on a WhatsApp group, claiming Om Prakash was trying to kill her and was drugging her daughter as well

title: Diving into SC’s verdict on Governors
content: The Supreme Court’s recent judgment in the Tamil Nadu Government’s suit against its Governor has done more than clear some Bills for the one State — it has set the tone for governments and Governors in a similar position in several other States

title: Doctor, hospital staffer sacked for dragging and assaulting a 77-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh government hospital
content: The man was accompanying his 70-year-old wife, a patient; hospital superintendent, who initially claimed the victim was “cutting the queue”, also suspended; FIR filed with charges of criminal intimidation

title: Aaron Rodgers sparks NFL outrage, fans accuse QB of attention-seeking stunt
content: Aaron Rodgers' prolonged indecision regarding the Pittsburgh Steelers' contract offer has sparked humorous reactions, including trolling from former teammate David Bakhtiari. As Rodgers remains non-committal, the Steelers are exploring options like Shedeur Sanders in the upcoming NFL Draft. Rodgers' philosophical approach contrasts with the Steelers' urgency to secure their quarterback future, creating a tense waiting game.

title: 'Over 2,000 violations by Russia of Putin's Easter truce': Zelenskyy
content: President Zelenskyy accused Russian forces of over 2,000 ceasefire violations during the announced Easter truce, citing numerous assaults and shelling incidents. Despite this, he noted the absence of air raid alerts and proposed a cessation of long-range drone strikes on civilian infrastructure for at least 30 days.

title: States push labour reforms amid delay in notifying codes
content: With the national labour codes awaiting implementation, numerous states are proactively amending their labour laws to attract investments and boost manufacturing. These changes include raising the retrenchment threshold, increasing worker limits for Factories and Contract Labour Acts, and permitting women to work night shifts.

title: Punjab cop resting knee on protesting teacher’s chest sparks row
content: A Punjab cop's action of kneeling on a protester during a demonstration in Anandpur Sahib has drawn comparisons to George Floyd's case, sparking outrage and accusations of Punjab becoming a "police state." Opposition parties, farm groups, and others have criticized Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, citing his past promises against police brutality.

title: Minority persecution claims baseless: Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh has refuted India's accusations of systematic minority persecution following the death of Hindu leader Bhabesh Chandra Roy. India condemned the killing as part of a pattern and urged protection for minorities. Bangladesh insists it protects all citizens equally, regardless of religion. Authorities are investigating Roy's death, citing no immediate signs of injury and cautioning against inciteful commentary.

title: Blind baby dumped in bin now in Nagpur DM’s office
content: Mala Papalkar, a visually challenged woman rescued from a dustbin at Jalgaon railway station 25 years ago, overcame immense odds. After clearing the MPSC exam, she is now poised to begin her career as a revenue assistant in Nagpur collectorate. Her journey from abandonment to public service is truly inspiring.

title: RSS chief calls for ‘one temple, one well & one cremation ground’ in Hindu community
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, during his Aligarh visit, advocated for 'Panch Parivartan' to foster social unity and eliminate caste differences. He emphasized having common community resources like temples, wells, and crematoriums. Bhagwat urged volunteers to promote social harmony, cultural revival, and family values.

title: Elderly caregiver dragged out of hospital by MP doctor
content: In Chhatarpur, Madhya Pradesh, a shocking incident occurred at a state-run district hospital where a 77-year-old man, Udhal Lal Joshi, was allegedly assaulted by Dr. Rajesh Mishra and an assistant.

title: Testimonies of 4-yr-olds lead to rape conviction
content: In Hyderabad, a 40-year-old man has been convicted and sentenced to 25 years for sexually assaulting a four-year-old girl. A city court relied on the testimonies of the survivor and her friend, both minors, to secure the conviction. The survivor, a Dalit, was also awarded Rs 5 lakh in compensation.

title: VHP, Bajrang Dal disrupt Easter meet
content: VHP and Bajrang Dal activists disrupted an Easter prayer meet in Odhav, Ahmedabad, alleging religious conversion. The activists, chanting slogans and wielding sticks, entered the gathering and demanded attendees leave. Police responded to the scene after being alerted, and are currently investigating complaints from both the activists and the Christian group. No physical altercations were reported.

title: Mehndi event in Bihar turns tragic as dancer dies in celebratory firing
content: A 21-year-old dancer, Shanu Khan, tragically died during a 'mehendi' ceremony in Darbhanga, Bihar, after being shot amidst celebratory firing. Khan and her troupe were forced to perform at gunpoint before the fatal incident. Police have filed a case against Ram Vinay Singh, who hired the group, and his family, all of whom have fled.

title: Arts and science colleges enter the arena of entrepreneurism
content: With the spread of start-up culture, colleges are improving their incubation cells and forging partnerships with the key players in the entrepreneurial ecosystem. As a result, more students pursuing arts and science courses are venturing into entrepreneurship

title: Historic representation of women in Civil Services: Union Minister Jitendra Singh
content: The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) praises record women’s representation in IAS batch, with 74 women officers make up 41% of the 2023 batch of the Indian Administrative Service

title: Staff Selection Commission implements Aadhaar-based authentication for its recruitment exams
content: Aadhaar authentication aims to prevent identity fraud and ensure the integrity of the recruitment process for government jobs

title: Race for Dalit outreach intensifies in Uttar Pradesh
content: While the SP is pitching its PDA formula as a forum for Dalit upliftment against the ruling BJP, the BSP says the SP is the extreme casteist party

title: Murshidabad violence | Mamata is the ‘Durga of the RSS’, says West Bengal CPI(M) leader
content: CPI(M)‘s Md Salim blames the RSS for the conspiracy behind the Murshidabad riots and says the CM also wanted them to occur; this comes a day after the CM accused the RSS of a “vicious false campaign”

title: Nishikant Dubey slams former CEC Quraishi, calls him ‘Muslim commissioner’
content: His remarks come a day after the ruling party distanced itself from the MP’s comments against the Supreme Court and Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna

title: NCW stresses need for confidence-building measures in Murshidabad; Trinamool MPs visit violence-hit areas
content: The family of the father and son who were killed in the violence decline compensation from the State government

title: Job working powerloom weavers in Coimbatore, Tiruppur districts withdraw month-long strike
content: Powerloom unit owners in Somanur, Avinashi, Kannampalayam, Thekkalur, Perumanallur, and Pudhupalayam in Coimbatore and Tiruppur districts went on strike demanding a hike in wages paid to them by the master weavers.

title: Vande Bharat trains prone to ‘serious accidents’ even in collisions with cattle; report calls for safety measures
content: Railways told to identify regular trespassing locations/cattle ingress and devise suitable mechanism such as deployment of RPF personnel, regular patrolling and providing subway to facilitate farmers to cross over with cattle

title: BJP attempts to court an unlikely backward class and Dalit demographic ahead of 2026 Assembly polls
content: It has elevated 225 leaders from Other Backward Classes and 75 Dalit leaders to pivotal positions in the organisation’s district-level leadership ahead of the 2025 local body polls and the 2026 Assembly elections

title: On Thackeray brothers’ reunion talks, Sanjay Raut says ‘bond was never broken’
content: The Sena UBT MP says at present there is no alliance in place between Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray but only emotional talks that are going on

title: Over 500 works as part of pre-monsoon cleaning in capital
content: While city Corporation’s sanitation workers will take care of a good number of the drains, Minor and Major Irrigation departments will be handling most of the canals

title: Special health camps held after three deaths in Woraiyur
content: Water supply has been suspended in the area and water is being supplied to Ward Nos. 8 and 10 through tankers; a team of workers is trying identify the cause of contamination

title: Govt committed to punishing guilty in ‘janivara’ row, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: Earlier, speaking to press persons after visiting Manjunatha Temple at Dharmasthala, the Deputy Chief Minister said that the government will not take any decision in a hurry on implementing the recommendations of the Socio Economic and Educational Survey (caste census) Report.

title: Thiruvanaikoil residents exasperated with frequent disruption in power supply
content: Sources in TNPDC say there has been disruption in power supply ever since the collapse of two transmission towers on the Kollidam riverbed near Alagiripuram in Thiruvanaikoil a few months ago

title: India can be active player in developing international framework for responsible behaviour in space: EU envoy
content: Marjolijn van Deelen, European Union Special Envoy for Space, flags debris from Anti-Satellite weapon testing and Rendezvous and Proximity Operations (RPO) that threaten satellites as major concerns; cyber jamming and spoofing in space too are threats to delivering services to citizens, she says

title: To address demand of loco pilots, Railways fitting toilets in engines
content: Waterless urinal facilities provided in 883 locomotives since 2018, wherever feasible, says Ministry; 7,075 locos fitted with ACs; toilets being fitted in all new locos, older ones being retrofitted, says official

title: The unknown story of Peerumade’s first school in a tea estate bungalow
content: Said to have housed in the Penshurst Estate, a 150-year-old estate in Peerumade, there are no official records about the school or of the woman who began the school

title: Non-Muslim members in waqf boards is akin to reservations for them: Hyderabad MP
content: President of the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi points out that given the omission of the relevant section, in a scenario in which there arises a conflict between waqf laws and any other legislation, the latter would prevail

title: Cab shortage worsens at Bengaluru airport as BluSmart halts operations
content: Commuters left scrambling for alternatives amid limited other ride hailing cab availability in Bengaluru airport

title: Film industry should adopt Vincy’s stance of not working with those using drugs: M.B. Rajesh
content: Minister says no sector will be given any special consideration or exemption in the efforts to fully free Kerala from the influence of narcotic substances

title: Webinar for CA Aspirants to be held
content: Ramanathan Krishnan, senior programme convenor, Department of Commerce, Shiv Nadar University Chennai and Chella Krishna G., chartered accountant and partner, SRSV Associates, Chennai will speak at the webinar

title: DGCA probes Air India Express ‘tail strike’ in Tiruchi airport
content: Airport sources said the Air India Express flight from Dubai with about 150 passengers on board was landing at the Tiruchi airport when the tail portion touched the runway surface.

title: D.K. Shivakumar treading carefully on caste census
content: Since the State Cabinet took up the caste census, Mr. Shivakumar has remained mostly neutral by not overtly speaking about the ‘injustice’ to the Vokkaliga community, though in the past he has criticised the H. Kantharaj Commission’s survey.

title: Former senior official criticises Andhra Pradesh government for its plan to operate 10 medical colleges under PPP mode
content: Development is not about building roads, buying luxury cars or showing GDP figures, but it is about ensuring that people across the State live healthy lives, he says

title: 775 died in calamities, 95 in fire accidents in past two years in A.P.
content: APSDRF rescues 1,420 persons during the calamities, and the Fire Services Department officials save 29 people in fire fighting operations

title: Consumer welfare association pleads with govt. to reconstruct UPHC building in Nagapattinam
content: Although ₹1.2 crore was sanctioned under the National Health Mission for reconstruction of the buildingty, the work is yet to begin, says the association

title: Arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari opposes ED’s plea to declare him ‘fugitive’, calls his stay in U.K. legal
content: The High Court of Justice, London, U.K., in February allowed Bhandari’s appeal against his extradition to face charges of alleged tax evasion and money laundering. Bhandari claims his stay in the U.K. was legal since his extradition to India was denied by the London High Court.

title: Police begin probe into financial transactions, call details of actor Shine Tom Chacko
content: He had been booked under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Section 238 (causing disappearance of evidence of offence) and the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act Sections 27 (b) (consumption of any narcotic drug or psychotropic substance) and Section 29 (punishment for abetment and criminal conspiracy)

title: Venugopal seeks action against BJP MP for ‘trying to intimidate Supreme Court’
content: He says open statements against judiciary will have serious consequences for democracy of our country

title: Overloaded goshalas in Uttara Kannada refuse to take in more rescued cattle
content: The district goshala in Haliyal taluk, which can house 100 cattle, has 140 cattle, while the 10 privately managed goshalas also have cattle much beyond their carrying capacity

title: Congress-led Opposition alliance hits turbulence ahead of Assam panchayat polls
content: The grand old party reacts to Raijor Dal president and MLA Akhil Gogoi accusing MP Gaurav Gogoi and others of batting for the BJP

title: Education must reach the poor among all castes, says Siddaramaiah
content: Survey has produced empirical data that is essential to take up welfare and development programmes for all communities, says Chief Minister

title: Need for early diagnosis of kidney diseases stressed
content: Doctors talk of issues relating to kidney diseases at a transplant awareness event, where donors and survivors participated

title: Flash floods in Ramban: J&K CM Abdullah, L-G Sinha grieve rain-related deaths; assure relief, assistance to those affected
content: “My thoughts are with the affected families in this difficult hour. We are in touch with the local administration to ensure immediate rescue efforts wherever needed. Later today, I will be reviewing restoration, relief, and repair plans,” J&K CM Omar Abdullah said

title: Arraez exits hospital, rejoins Padres after win
content: San Diego designated hitter Luis Arraez returned to the stadium postgame after he was taken to a hospital following a collision with Mauricio Dubon on a play at first base in the first inning of the Padres' 3-2 win over the Houston Astros on Sunday night.

title: Top portal QB Iamaleava transferring to UCLA
content: Tennessee quarterback Nico Iamaleava officially announced his transfer to UCLA via a social media post Sunday, citing an "incredibly difficult" decision.

title: Cavs ride Jerome heater to Game 1 win vs. Heat
content: Cavaliers sparkplug Ty Jerome went off in Game 1 against the Heat, scoring or assisting on 24 consecutive points to close out the victory in the fourth.

title: NBA unveils award finalists for 2024-25 season
content: The NBA unveiled the three finalists for each of its seven major individual awards for the 2024-25 regular season Sunday night.

title: Yanks' Fried loses no-hit bid after scorer's change
content: New York Yankees veteran left-hander Max Fried lost a no-hit bid in Sunday's 4-0 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays just as the bottom of the eighth inning was about to start when the official scorer changed a sixth-inning call to a hit from an error.

title: Sources: UGA lands transfer trio, including top LB
content: A trio of transfers -- Army outside linebacker Elo Modozie, Illinois running back Josh McCray and Miami defensive lineman Josh Horton -- have signed with Georgia, sources told ESPN.

title: Top-5 Class of '25 recruit Ament commits to Vols
content: Nate Ament, a top-5 recruit and the best available high school prospect in the 2025 class, has committed to Tennessee, he told ESPN Sunday, saying afterward that "I built a great relationship with the staff. I trust them, and they have big goals for me."

title: Thomas wins RBC Heritage, ending 3-year drought
content: Justin Thomas ended nearly three years without a victory Sunday by making a birdie putt from just outside 20 feet in a playoff at Harbour Town to beat Andrew Novak in the RBC Heritage.

title: Who’s the best player in the NFL draft? How about the 100th best? Legwold ranks them all
content: Jeff Legwold reveals his top prospect list, which is based purely on ability regardless of position. Who is No. 1?

title: NBA Rank, playoffs edition: The 50 most impactful players for 2025
content: From MVP hopefuls to postseason heroes, we're counting down the top 50 players who will decide the 2025 playoffs.

title: WrestleMania 41 Night 2 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist. Here are the best moments from WrestleMania 41 Night 2.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Leicester relegated from PL after loss to Liverpool
content: Leicester City have been condemned to an immediate return to the Championship after their relegation from the Premier League was confirmed with a defeat to Liverpool on Sunday.

title: TAA silent on Madrid links after 'special' winner
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold remained tight-lipped on his future at Anfield amid continued links to Real Madrid, although he added that Sunday's winner over Leicester City would always be "special."

title: Amorim defends Højlund despite scoring woes
content: Ruben Amorim has insisted that Rasmus Højlund is not solely to blame for Manchester United's problems scoring while also urging the rest of the team to take responsibility in front of goal.

title: Valverde 'the key' as Madrid 'react' to UCL exit
content: Carlo Ancelotti praised Federico Valverde as "the key" after the midfielder's 93rd-minute goal gave Real Madrid a dramatic 1-0 win over Athletic Club on Sunday to react to their Champions League exit in midweek.

title: Barcelona rout Chelsea in first leg of UWCL semis
content: Holders Barcelona put themselves in the driving seat with a resounding 4-1 over Chelsea in the first leg of their women's Champions League semifinal on Sunday, with substitute Claudia Pina netting twice.

title: Lewandowski (hamstring) in doubt for UCL semis
content: Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski is a major doubt for the Copa del Rey final and the Champions League semifinal, sources told ESPN after the team confirmed he has a hamstring injury.

title: St. Pauli draw leaves Leverkusen defence near end
content: Reigning champions Bayer Leverkusen slipped up with a 1-1 draw at St Pauli on Sunday to drop eight points behind leaders Bayern Munich as their slim hopes of defending the Bundesliga title were all but ended.

title: Arteta says Saka 'in pain' but quashes injury fears
content: Arsenal's Mikel Arteta said Bukayo Saka was left in pain after suffering a knock in the 4-0 win at Ipswich, although he ruled out any chance of a "serious" injury.

title: Outfought and outclassed by Barcelona, Chelsea look cooked in Champions League semi
content: Chelsea will need to produce the best performance in their 33-year history to overturn a 4-1 defeat to Barcelona in the Women's Champions League.

title: Ingrid Lindblad wins LA Championship in third start
content: Ingrid Lindblad won the JM Eagle LA Championship on Sunday in her third start as an LPGA Tour member.

title: How Piastri-Verstappen incident led to McLaren's Saudi win
content: After nearly colliding on Lap 1 Max Verstappen was forced to yield to eventual Saudi GP winner Oscar Piastri.

title: In Karnataka Ex-Top Cop's Murder, Wife Prime Suspect, Fought Over Property
content: The wife has been taken as a prime suspect in the murder of Karnataka's former police chief, Om Prakash, who was found dead in his Bengaluru home yesterday, with multiple stab wounds to his abdomen and chest.

title: Wife Threw Chilli Powder At Ex Top Cop, Tied Him Up, Stabbed Him: Sources
content: Former Karnataka Police chief Om Prakash, who was found dead at his Bengaluru home yesterday, had a fight with his wife in the afternoon. During this fight, she allegedly threw chilli powder at him, tied him up and then stabbed him to death

title: Yemen War Plan Blunder: Did Pentagon Chief Leak Chats To Family?
